definition: to talk
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
empty talk/mere rhetoric/palaver
to move one's lips/to wag one's tongue
erhua variant of 動嘴皮|动嘴皮[dong4 zui3 pi2]
see 動嘴皮|动嘴皮[dong4 zui3 pi2]

sentences.english: Hardly anyone has bothered to reply.
The more times you move your mouth.
Mind-reading devices could help people who cannot speak communicate.
sentences.chinese: 读取思想的设备帮助人们无需动嘴就能实现彼此交流。

sentences.english: You must show your support by deeds, not words.
sentences.chinese: 你必须用行动支持，而不只是动动嘴。

definition: to use one's mouth (to say sth)
lit. lips/fig. glib talk
a gentleman uses his mouth and not his fist
pinyin: jun1 zi3 dong4 kou3 bu4 dong4 shou3

definition: to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
to use one's brain
to set about (a task)/to hit/to punch/to touch
to retort/to answer back
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
to use one's brains/to think
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
